results.title: Kingdom of the Lyrebird
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Jenny Erdos and Laszlo Erdos
results.brief_description: A unique film of one of the world’s rarest, largest and most spectacular songbirds. Includes extraordinary footage of the Lyrebird as it mimics the songs of some of the beautiful birds with which it shares its kingdom in Australia’s great Rainforests. Filmed entirely in the wild and narrated by Frederick Parslow. Rated: G

results.title: Small Scale Vegetable Growing
results.brief_description: James Murison, Australian horticulturist, presents a comprehensive guide from site selection to long term storage of your vegetable crop and includes information on soil testing, drainage, fertilisers, pest and disease control and crop rotation.

results.title: The Blink of an eye
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
This is part two of “Filmstruck”, a series hosted by the well-known Australian film historian and cinema critic, John Baxter, which considers the impact of cinema on the social and personal life of the viewing audience. In this episode, John Baxter takes a closer look at cinema stunts and the men that performed them, from early Tom Mix to Mad Max 2.

results.title: Carving Techniques and Projects
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basics of gouge and chisel work, discussing the choice of tools, ideas and how to adjust designs. Shows how to carve the hallmark of 18th century furniture: the classic scallop shell.
results.description: Demonstrates the basics of gouge and chisel work, discussing the choice of tools, ideas and how to adjust designs. Shows how to carve the hallmark of 18th century furniture: the classic scallop shell.

results.title: Carve a Ball and Claw Foot
results.brief_description: Learn how to scale the ball-and-claw to furniture plan, how to machine stock to yield a graceful bandsaw cabriole leg ready for carving, how to lay out form, cut-in with a mallet and gouge and shape the dragon’s claw for a vigorous looking grip, how to carve efficiently, keeping tools sharp as you work.
results.description: Learn how to scale the ball-and-claw to furniture plan, how to machine stock to yield a graceful bandsaw cabriole leg ready for carving, how to lay out form, cut-in with a mallet and gouge and shape the dragon’s claw for a vigorous looking grip, how to carve efficiently, keeping tools sharp as you work.

results.title: Hit and Miss/One Voice
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Hit and Miss” we meet Adam, dealing with the pressures of school and family. The resulting conflict is resolved in a constructive way. A teenager who decides to take part in an anti-logging protest is featured in “One Voice” Amber is ostracised by her peers, but supported by her parents. Watch her confidence increase as she pursues her beliefs undeterred by the attitudes of her peers.

results.title: In Loving Memory. Alice
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Pamela Williams, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In Loving Memory - we meet Mary who develops cancer in primary school, and see the effects that the illness and treatment have on her life. Mary examines her relationship with family and friends and the value she puts on life. In “Alice” we meet an Aboriginal teenager who is subjected to racism, both at school and in the community. The effects of prejudice are seen as we eavesdrop on her thoughts and watch her achieve her ambitions despite the attacks on her self confidence.

results.title: Police State
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Rod Allan and Chris Noonan
results.brief_description: Police State is the story of corruption in the Queensland police force and body politic, realised through drama re-enactments, twenty years of news and documentary footage, and a compelling narrative. In the final years of the Bjelke-Petersen administration, Queensland has become as close to a police state as anything since the convict era. “Police State” puts into perspective the headlines which have dominated the Australian media for the past two years. Rated: PG

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Barry Letts and BBC
results.brief_description: The story centres around two devoted sisters, Elinor, whose dignity and restraint represents “sense” and Marianne, excitable and impetuous, who represents “sensibility”. Forced by tragic circumstances to set about the delicate task of finding suitable husbands the two sisters suffer a series of disappointments and wonder if they will ever find true love and happiness. A dramatic adaptation of the novel by Jane Austen.
